db:abstract.db:para: The QListWidget class provides an item-based list widget.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QListWidget is a convenience class that provides a list view similar to the one supplied by QListView, but with a classic item-based interface for adding and removing items. QListWidget uses an internal model to manage each QListWidgetItem in the list.
For a more flexible list view widget, use the QListView class with a standard model.
List widgets are constructed in the same way as other widgets:

The selectionMode() of a list widget determines how many of the items in the list can be selected at the same time, and whether complex selections of items can be created. This can be set with the setSelectionMode() function.

There are two ways to add items to the list: they can be constructed with the list widget as their parent widget, or they can be constructed with no parent widget and added to the list later. If a list widget already exists when the items are constructed, the first method is easier to use:

If you need to insert a new item into the list at a particular position, then it should be constructed without a parent widget. The insertItem() function should then be used to place it within the list. The list widget will take ownership of the item.
For multiple items, insertItems() can be used instead. The number of items in the list is found with the count() function. To remove items from the list, use takeItem().

The current item in the list can be found with currentItem(), and changed with setCurrentItem(). The user can also change the current item by navigating with the keyboard or clicking on a different item. When the current item changes, the currentItemChanged() signal is emitted with the new current item and the item that was previously current.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] count : const int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the number of items in the list including any hidden items.

db:section.db:title: currentRow : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the row of the current item.
Depending on the current selection mode, the row may also be selected.

db:section.db:title: sortingEnabled : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether sorting is enabled
If this property is true, sorting is enabled for the list; if the property is false, sorting is not enabled.
The default value is false.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QListWidget::QListWidget(QWidget *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs an empty QListWidget with the given parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QListWidget::~QListWidget()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the list widget and all its items.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::addItem(const QString &label)
db:section.db:para: Inserts an item with the text label at the end of the list widget.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::addItem(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Inserts the item at the end of the list widget.

db:warning.db:para: A QListWidgetItem can only be added to a QListWidget once. Adding the same QListWidgetItem multiple times to a QListWidget will result in undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::addItems(const QStringList &labels)
db:section.db:para: Inserts items with the text labels at the end of the list widget.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::clear()
db:section.db:para: Removes all items and selections in the view.

db:warning.db:para: All items will be permanently deleted.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::closePersistentEditor(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Closes the persistent editor for the given item.

db:section.db:title: QListWidgetItem *QListWidget::currentItem() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current item.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::currentItemChanged(QListWidgetItem *current, QListWidgetItem *previous)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the current item changes.
previous is the item that previously had the focus; current is the new current item.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::currentRowChanged(int currentRow)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the current item changes.
currentRow is the row of the current item. If there is no current item, the currentRow is -1.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::currentTextChanged(const QString &currentText)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the current item changes.
currentText is the text data in the current item. If there is no current item, the currentText is invalid.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] void QListWidget::dropEvent(QDropEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QListView::dropEvent(QDropEvent *event).

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] bool QListWidget::dropMimeData(int index, const QMimeData *data, Qt::DropAction action)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: bool dropMimeData(int index, const QMimeData *data, Qt::DropAction action)

db:section.db:para: Handles data supplied by an external drag and drop operation that ended with the given action in the given index. Returns true if data and action can be handled by the model; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::editItem(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Starts editing the item if it is editable.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] bool QListWidget::event(QEvent *e)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QListView::event(QEvent *e).

db:section.db:title: QList<QListWidgetItem *> QListWidget::findItems(const QString &text, Qt::MatchFlags flags) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QList<QListWidgetItem *> findItems(const QString &text, Qt::MatchFlags flags) const

db:section.db:para: Finds items with the text that matches the string text using the given flags.

db:section.db:title: QModelIndex QListWidget::indexFromItem(const QListWidgetItem *item) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QModelIndex associated with the given item.

db:note.db:para: In Qt versions prior to 5.10, this function took a non-const item.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::insertItem(int row, QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Inserts the item at the position in the list given by row.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::insertItem(int row, const QString &label)
db:section.db:para: Inserts an item with the text label in the list widget at the position given by row.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::insertItems(int row, const QStringList &labels)
db:section.db:para: Inserts items from the list of labels into the list, starting at the given row.

db:section.db:title: bool QListWidget::isPersistentEditorOpen(QListWidgetItem *item) const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether a persistent editor is open for item item.

db:section.db:title: QListWidgetItem *QListWidget::item(int row) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item that occupies the given row in the list if one has been set; otherwise returns nullptr.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemActivated(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the item is activated. The item is activated when the user clicks or double clicks on it, depending on the system configuration. It is also activated when the user presses the activation key (on Windows and X11 this is the Return key, on Mac OS X it is Command+O).

db:section.db:title: QListWidgetItem *QListWidget::itemAt(const QPoint &p) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a pointer to the item at the coordinates p. The coordinates are relative to the list widget's viewport().

db:section.db:title: QListWidgetItem *QListWidget::itemAt(int x, int y) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QListWidgetItem * itemAt(int x, int y) const

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a pointer to the item at the coordinates (x, y). The coordinates are relative to the list widget's viewport().

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemChanged(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the data of item has changed.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemClicked(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted with the specified item when a mouse button is clicked on an item in the widget.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemDoubleClicked(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted with the specified item when a mouse button is double clicked on an item in the widget.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemEntered(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the mouse cursor enters an item. The item is the item entered. This signal is only emitted when mouseTracking is turned on, or when a mouse button is pressed while moving into an item.

db:section.db:title: QListWidgetItem *QListWidget::itemFromIndex(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a pointer to the QListWidgetItem associated with the given index.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemPressed(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted with the specified item when a mouse button is pressed on an item in the widget.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::itemSelectionChanged()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the selection changes.

db:section.db:title: QWidget *QListWidget::itemWidget(QListWidgetItem *item) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the widget displayed in the given item.

db:section.db:title: QList<QListWidgetItem *> QListWidget::items(const QMimeData *data) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of pointers to the items contained in the data object. If the object was not created by a QListWidget in the same process, the list is empty.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] QMimeData *QListWidget::mimeData(const QList<QListWidgetItem *> &items) const
db:section.db:para: Returns an object that contains a serialized description of the specified items. The format used to describe the items is obtained from the mimeTypes() function.
If the list of items is empty, nullptr is returned instead of a serialized empty list.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] QStringList QListWidget::mimeTypes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of MIME types that can be used to describe a list of listwidget items.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::openPersistentEditor(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Opens an editor for the given item. The editor remains open after editing.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::removeItemWidget(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Removes the widget set on the given item.
To remove an item (row) from the list entirely, either delete the item or use takeItem().

db:section.db:title: int QListWidget::row(const QListWidgetItem *item) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the row containing the given item.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::scrollToItem(const QListWidgetItem *item, QAbstractItemView::ScrollHint hint = EnsureVisible)
db:section.db:para: Scrolls the view if necessary to ensure that the item is visible.
hint specifies where the item should be located after the operation.

db:section.db:title: QList<QListWidgetItem *> QListWidget::selectedItems() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of all selected items in the list widget.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::setCurrentItem(QListWidgetItem *item)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current item to item.
Unless the selection mode is NoSelection, the item is also selected.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::setCurrentItem(QListWidgetItem *item, QItemSelectionModel::SelectionFlags command)
db:section.db:para: Set the current item to item, using the given command.

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::setCurrentRow(int row, QItemSelectionModel::SelectionFlags command)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current row to be the given row, using the given command,

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::setItemWidget(QListWidgetItem *item, QWidget *widget)
db:section.db:para: Sets the widget to be displayed in the given item.

This function should only be used to display static content in the place of a list widget item. If you want to display custom dynamic content or implement a custom editor widget, use QListView and subclass QStyledItemDelegate instead.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] void QListWidget::setSelectionModel(QItemSelectionModel *selectionModel)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemView::setSelectionModel(QItemSelectionModel *selectionModel).

db:section.db:title: void QListWidget::sortItems(Qt::SortOrder order = Qt::AscendingOrder)
db:section.db:para: Sorts all the items in the list widget according to the specified order.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] Qt::DropActions QListWidget::supportedDropActions() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the drop actions supported by this view.

db:section.db:title: QListWidgetItem *QListWidget::takeItem(int row)
db:section.db:para: Removes and returns the item from the given row in the list widget; otherwise returns nullptr.
Items removed from a list widget will not be managed by Qt, and will need to be deleted manually.

db:section.db:title: QRect QListWidget::visualItemRect(const QListWidgetItem *item) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the rectangle on the viewport occupied by the item at item.
